moves.1. c4:
This was a ladder game where I was challenged by a player with a considerably higher rating. From my perspective the result was a good one but I'm still not sure if I should have carried on the game for a little longer.

We start with my favored English opening. I decided to go for this as I know it better than most openings
moves.1... e5 2. Nc3 Nf6 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. g3 d5 5: The computer calls this a mistake preferring cxd5 Nxd5. My intention was to make the position more complex
I'm still not sure that I wouldn't have been better here taking with the king but at this point I still had hopes of castling
moves.8... bxc6: The three black pawns on the c file certainly cheered me up and gave me hope that this wouldn't be the decimation I expected at the beginning of the game
moves.9. Bg2 Bb4+ 10. Nc3 Nd5 11. O-O: This takes us out of the Gameknot database where the preference is Bd2
moves.11... Bxc3 12. Bxd5: At the time I thought this was the only way to prevent the loss of a pawn but the computer calls it a mistake preferring 12. bxc3 Rb8 13. Rd1 Nxc3 14. Bxc6+ Ke7 though I don't understand the suggestion of Rb8 in preference to say Nxc3.
moves.12... cxd5 13. bxc3 Bh3: I don't like this move in this position, all it does is force me to move the rook which I was inclined to do anyway. My plan now was to prevent black from castling with Ba3 which will be hard to extricate
moves.14. Rd1: Would Re1 have been any better? I think with hindsight it would have been
moves.14... c6 15. Ba3 Kd7 16. e4 Ke6 17. exd5:
At this point black suprised me a little by offering a draw which I gladly accepted, the question is, should I have carried on a little longer?

Thanks for reading please comment
